title: Did the 1938 Radio Broadcast of ‘War of the Worlds’ Cause a Nationwide Panic?
subtitle: Accounts conflict about how terrified Americans really were by Orson Welles' infamous 1938 "War of the Worlds" Halloween broadcast.
author: David Emery
vclaim: Orson Welles' 30 October 1938 radio adaptation of "The War of the Worlds" caused mass hysteria, convincing thousands of panicked listeners across North America that Earth was being attacked by Mars.
